body:
Comment 5: 
The time package Parse function allows you to parse zero or more time element values,
such as year, month, day, minute, hour, second, weekday, and time zone, that may or may
not represent a valid date, using a format string. Weekday may or may not be useful to
you, and it's computable from only some combinations of time element values. Therefore,
it's sensible to apply the rule that only values that you explicitly request are
returned as values. Since you requested the time element values in the format, you know
which values are returned. The time Parse function returns sane time element values; it
doesn't perform consistency and other validity checks. It leaves that to you.

For example, a valid and real use case is "Feb 31"; it represents a periodic date, the
last day of February. Or, "2011 March 3 Wednesday" represents the third Wednesday in
February 2011.
